Attributes.description:
- Have a foundational understanding of basic ML theory, including the use of probabilistic frameworks to explain fundamental models such as linear regression, logistic regression, neural networks, PCA, and SVM.
- Possess a good knowledge of state-of-the-art (SOTA) models in the general ML and deep learning fields, including XGBoost, diffusion models, BERT, and VAE.
- Have hands-on experience in building deep neural network models and performing data preprocessing tasks using frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, scikit-learn, and Keras. Additionally, be familiar with deploying models using platforms like TensorFlow Serving and ONNX.
Attributes.confidence: confident, willing to share and discuss the details

Attributes.description:

 - but not familiar with causal inference 
- familiar with probability distributions and statistical inference methods 
- proficient in statistical software and programming languages such as R and Python, and their libraries such as pandas, numpy, scipy, etc. 
- capable of performing data analysis and visualization
Attributes.confidence: confident, willing to share and discuss the details

Topics.Name: Predicting Financial Trends Using Machine Learning

Attributes.description:
- a final project in the year 4 course: COMP SCI 540 â€” INTRODUCTION TO ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE 
- applied NBEATS and NHITS models within NeuralForecast to predict the price trend of NVDA stock
- integrated exogenous variables such as market trends, economic indicators, and industry news to enrich model insights, applying statistical inference using Python libraries such as pandas and NumPy.
- streamlined training, testing, and forecasting processes, with models demonstrating remarkable accuracy even in volatile markets.
- used the plotly package to do the data visialization
- yet faced challenges with computational costs and model complexity, making real-time forecasting difficult.
Attributes.willingness: willing to discuss the details, but not the constraints

Attributes.description:
- provides more succinct and precise answers.
- avoids elaboration or unnecessary details to maintain brevity. 
 -will make sure the answer is enough for the question
Attributes.examples:
- CCC1 I only provide the key points in my answers. 
- CCC2 I focus on answering the question directly without too much commentary.
- CCC3 I keep my responses limited to one or two sentences unless further details are requested.
  -CCC4 I would like to provide more detials if the interviewer asks for more details (follow-up questions). 
- CCC5 I prepare answers that are direct and to the point.
Attributes.frequency: consistently applied throughout the interview unless asked to elaborate
Attributes.strength: To a reasonable and normal extent
Attributes.scope: applied to all types of interview questions

Public.aspects:
Key job responsibilities
- Develop new forecasting models or improve existing approaches using scalable techniques.
- Extract data for analysis and model development from large, complex datasets to explain demand trends.
- Closely work with engineering teams to build scalable, efficient systems that implement prototypes in production.
Preferred aspects:
- Experience in Python, Perl, or another scripting language
- Experience in a ML or data scientist role with a large technology company
- Knowledge of relevant statistical measures such as confidence intervals, significance of error measurements, development and evaluation data sets, etc.
- Experience with applied time series modeling, causal inference, or machine learning forecasting applications.
Public.short-cv:
Degree: B.S., Computer Science, Wisconsin Madison, graduated in 2024.6
 GPA: 3.6/4.0, First class honor
 Knowledge scopes: machine learning, statistics
 Programming skills: Python, R, SQL, TensorFlow, PyTorch, SK-learn, Keras, MapReduce
 Project experience: Predicting financial trends using machine learning, which aims to apply machine learning models to predict financial market trends
